translations.text: Verily the Scorch! that shall be his resort.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, his abode will be Hell-fire;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then Hell is the shelter.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: most surely his abode shall be Hell.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, his abode will be the Hell;

translations.text: Lo! hell will be his home.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: his refuge will indeed be hell.

translations.text: Then indeed, Hellfire will be [his] refuge.

translations.text: will find himself in Hell;

translations.text: The Abode will be Hell-Fire;

verses.text: وَ أَمَّا مَنْ‌ خَافَ‌ مَقَامَ‌ رَبِّهِ‌ وَ نَهَى‌ النَّفْسَ‌ عَنِ‌ الْهَوَى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اما کسی که از مقام و منزلت پروردگارش ترسیده و نفس را از هوا و هوس بازداشته است؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما هر كس كه از ايستادن در برابر پروردگارش ترسيده و نفس را از هوى بازداشته،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اما آن كس كه از مقام پروردگارش ترسان بود و خويشتن را از هوس‌ها بازداشت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اما كسى كه از ايستادن در برابر پروردگارش هراسيد، و نفس خود را از هوس باز داشت...

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هر کس از حضور در پیشگاه عزّ ربوبیت بترسید و از هوای نفس دوری جست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و امّا آن کس که از جاه و مقام پروردگار خود ترسیده باشد، و نفس را از هوا و هوس بازداشته باشد. [[«مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ»: (نگا: رحمن / 46، ابراهیم / 14). مَقام، در اصل به معنی جایگاه اقامت است. در اینجا مراد شخص حاضر در آن است که ذات خداوند سبحان است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اما هر کس که از ایستادن [در موضع حساب و حشر] در پیشگاه پروردگارش ترسیده و نفس را از هوی و هوس بازداشته باشد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آن کس که از مقام پروردگارش ترسان باشد و نفس را از هوی بازدارد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و امّا آنکه بترسد جایگاه پروردگار خویش را و بازدارد خویشتن را از هوسها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اما هر كس كه از مقام پروردگار خود- يا از ايستادن در پيشگاه پروردگارش- ترسيد و خويشتن را از آرزو و كام دل بازداشت،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اما کسی که از مقام پروردگارش هراسید، و نفس (خود) را از هوس باز داشت،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But he who feared standing before his Lord, and restrained his self from vain desires,

translations.text: And for one who feared to stand before his Lord and restrained his soul from desire,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But as for him who feared the Station of his Lord and forbade the soul its caprice,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And as for him who dreaded standing before his Lord, and restrained his soul from lust,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But as for him who feared standing before his Lord, and restrained himself from impure evil desires, and lusts.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But as for him who feared the Standing of his Lord, and restrained the self from desires.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But he who feared to stand before his Lord, and restrained himself from evil desires,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But as for him who feared standing before his Lord, and forbade himself from desire.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But as for him who feared to stand before his Lord and restrained his soul from lust,

translations.text: But as for him who is awed to stand before his Lord and restrains his soul from [following] desires,

translations.text: But, whosoever feared the standing before his Lord and prevented the self from desires,

translations.text: But as for he who feared the position of his Lord and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,

translations.text: However, those who had feared their Lord and restrained their souls from acting according to its desires.

translations.text: قطعاً بهشت جایگاه اوست!

translations.text: پس همانا بهشت جايگاه اوست.

translations.text: پس بی‌گمان پناهگاهش بهشت است.

translations.text: Will surely have Paradise for abode.

translations.text: Then indeed Paradise only is his destination.

translations.text: surely Paradise shall be the refuge.

translations.text: Verily the Garden! -that shall be his resort.

translations.text: همواره ازتو درباره قیامت می پرسند که در چه زمانی واقع می شود؟

translations.text: از تو سؤال کنند که قیامت کی بر پا شود؟

translations.text: از تو درباره‌ی قیامت می‌پرسند که در چه زمانی واقع می‌شود؟ [[«أَیَّانَ»: چه وقت؟ کی؟ «مُرْسَاهَا»: وقوع قیامت و برپا شدن آن. مصدر میمی است از إِرْساء (نگا: اعراف / 187، هود / 41).]]

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They ask you: "When will the Hour be? When is its time fixed?"

translations.text: They (the disbelievers) ask you regarding the Last Day, as to when is its appointed time.

translations.text: They will question thee concerning the Hour, when it shall berth.

translations.text: They ask you about the Hour, “When will it take place?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi

translations.text: They ask thee about the Hour,-'When will be its appointed time?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: تو از بسیار یاد کردنش [و سخن گفتن درباره آن] چه به دست می آوری؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از يادكردن آن تو را چه كار است؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تو را با سخن گفتن در آن چه كار

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تو را چه به گفتگو در آن.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تو را چه کار است دیگر که از آن به یاد آری؟ (بسیار یاد آور شدی و منکران از تو نپذیرفتند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو را چه آگهی و خبر از آن؟! (تو چیزی از آن نمی‌دانی). [[«فِیمَ»: مخفّف (فِی مَا) است. «ذِکْری»: خبر دادن. بیان کردن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تو در مقامی نیستی که از آن یاد کنی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تو را با یادآوری این سخن چه کار؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: در چیستی تو از یادآوردنش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تو از ياد آن در چه چيزى؟- از هنگام آمدن آن چه خبر دارى-؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: تو در چه (شناختی) از یادواره‌ی آنی‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: What do you have to do with explaining it?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: What concern do you have regarding its explanation? (You are not bound to tell them)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What art thou about, to mention it?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherein art thou concerred with the declaration thereof!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: You have no knowledge to say anything about it,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: You have no knowledge of it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: What concern do you have to speak about that?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: What do you have to mention of it.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Why (ask they)? What hast thou to tell thereof?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: considering your frequent mention of it?”

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But how are you to know?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: In what [position] are you that you should mention it?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), you do not know (when and how) it will come.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: About what! You are one to remind of it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Feema anta min <u>th</u>ikr<u>a</u>h<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: what have you to do with the mentioning of it?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Wherein art thou (concerned) with the declaration thereof?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: نهایتش به سوی پروردگار توست [کیفیت برپا شدن و زمان وقوع و اوصافش را کسی جز خدا نمی داند.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: منتهاى آن نزد پروردگار توست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سر انجام آن به جانب پروردگار توست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: علم آن با پروردگار تو است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: کار آن ساعت به خدای تو منتهی شود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آگاهیِ از زمان قیامت، به پروردگارت واگذار می‌گردد (و اطّلاع از وقوع آن کار پروردگار تو است؛ نه تو). [[«مُنتَهی»: انتهاء. واگذاری (نگا: نجم / 14 و 42). «إِلی رَبِّکَ مُنتَهَاهَا»: چکیده مطلب این است: تنها خداوند از وقوع قیامت آگاه است و بس (نگا: اعراف / 187، لقمان / 34).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: منتهای علم آن با پروردگارت توست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: نهایت آن به سوی پروردگار تو است (و هیچ کس جز خدا از زمانش آگاه نیست)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بسوی پروردگار تو است پایانش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [دانش‌] پايانه و سرانجام آن با پروردگار توست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پایانش فراسوی پروردگار توست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The extent of its knowledge goes to your Lord.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Towards your Lord only is its conclusion.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Unto thy Lord is the final end of it.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Unto thy Lord is the Knowledge of the limit fixed therefor.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: To your Lord belongs (the knowledge of) the term thereof?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: To your Lord is its finality.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Its knowledge rests with your Lord.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: To your Lord it is limited.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Unto thy Lord belongeth (knowledge of) the term thereof.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Its outcome is with your Lord.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Its final end is for your Lord.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: To your Lord is its finality.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This matter is in the hands of your Lord.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: To your Lord is the goal of it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Il<u>a</u> rabbika muntah<u>a</u>h<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Your Lord alone knows when it will come;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: With thy Lord in the Limit fixed therefor.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: وظیفه تو فقط بیم دادن کسانی است که همواره از آن می ترسند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: جز اين نيست كه تو كسانى را كه از آن روز بترسند بيم مى‌دهى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تو فقط بيم دهنده‌ى كسى هستى كه از آن بترسد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تو فقط كسى را كه از آن مى‌ترسد هشدار مى‌دهى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تو را جز این نباشد که اهل ایمان را هر کس از یاد آن روز هراسان می‌شود به اهوال آن روز آگاه سازی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: وظیفه‌ی تو تنها و تنها بیم دادن و هوشدار باش به کسانی است که از قیامت می‌ترسند (و روح حق‌جوئی و حق‌طلبی دارند). [[«مُنذِرُ»: بیم‌دهنده. اعلام خطرکننده. «مُنذِرُ مَن یَخْشَاهَا»: این گونه تعبیرات اشاره به این حقیقت است که اگر کسانی دچار طغیان نفسانی نشده باشند و بلکه اندیشناک بوده و آماده پذیرش حق باشند، گوش دل به اندرزهای آسمانی فرا می‌دهند، و ادلّه و برهان، خردهایشان را تکان می‌دهد (نگا: بقره / 2).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تو فقط هشداردهنده کسی هستی که از آن بهراسد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: کار تو فقط بیم‌دادن کسانی است که از آن می‌ترسند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز این نیست که توئی ترساننده آنکه بترسدش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تو تنها هر كس را كه از آن مى‌ترسد بيم‌دهنده‌اى و بس- آنچه به تو مربوط است همين است-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: تو تنها کسی را که از آن می‌هراسد هشدار می‌دهی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Your duty is only to warn him who fears it.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: You are but a Herald of Warning, for one who fears it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Thou art only the warner of him who fears it.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Thou art but a warner Unto him who feareth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: You (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) are only a warner for those who fear it,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: You are just a warner for whoever dreads it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: You are only a warner to him who has a fear of it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: You are only a warner for those who fear it,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thou art but a warner unto him who feareth it.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: You are only a warner for those who are afraid it.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: You are but a warner for those who fear it.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: You are only a warner for those who fear it.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You are only a warner for those who fear such a day.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: You are only a warner to him who would fear it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innam<u>a</u> anta mun<u>th</u>iru man yakhsh<u>a</u>h<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: you are but a warner for those who fear it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thou art but a Warner for such as fear it.

verses.text: کَأَنَّهُمْ‌ يَوْمَ‌ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ‌ يَلْبَثُوا إِلاَّ عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَاهَا

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گویی آنان روزی که قیامت را می بینند چنین می پندارند که در برزخ جز شامگاهی یا صبح گاه آن درنگ نکرده اند!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون آن را ببينند، پندارند در اين جهان جز يك شامگاه يا چاشت درنگ نكرده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: روزى كه آن را ببينند [پندارند كه‌]، گويى توقفشان [در دنيا] جز شامگاهى يا بامدادى بيش نبوده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: روزى كه آن را مى‌بينند، گويى كه آنان جز شبى يا روزى درنگ نكرده‌اند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چون آن روز را مردم ببینند گویی همه عمر دنیا شامگاهی یا چاشتگاهی بیش نبوده است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: روزی که آنان برپائی رستاخیز را می‌بینند (چنین احساس می‌کنند که در جهان) گوئی جز شامگاهی یا چاشتگاهی از آن درنگ نکرده‌اند و بسر نبرده‌اند. [[«لَمْ یَلْبَثُوا»: درنگ نکرده‌اند. نمانده‌اند و بسر نبرده‌اند (نگا: بقره / 259، مؤمنون / 112 و 114). «عَشِیَّةً»: شب هنگام. آخر روز. «ضُحی»: چاشتگاه. اوّل روز. «عَشِیَّةً أَوْضُحَاهَا»: مراد چند ساعتی است (نگا: یونس / 45، احقاف / 35، مؤمنون / 113). مرجع (هَا) واژه (عَشِیَّةً) است و بیانگر این است، صبحِ همان عصرگاه مراد است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: روزی که آن را بنگرند گویی جز شبانگاهی یا بامدادش [در دنیا] به سر نبرده‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها در آن روز که قیام قیامت را می‌بینند چنین احساس می‌کنند که گویی توقّفشان (در دنیا و برزخ) جز شامگاهی یا صبح آن بیشتر نبوده است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گوئیا ایشان روزی که بینندش نماندند جز شبی یا روزش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گويى كه آنان روزى كه آن را ببينند درنگ نكرده‌اند- در دنيا يا در گور- مگر شامگاهى يا چاشتگاهى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: روزی که آن را می‌بینند، گویی آنان بی‌گمان جز شبی یا روزش را درنگ نکرده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The day they see it, it will seem they had stayed in the world but only an evening or its turning into dawn.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The day when they will see it, it will seem as if they had not stayed on earth except for an evening or its morning.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It shall be as if; on the day they see it, they have but tarried for an evening, or its forenoon.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: On the Day whereon they behold it, it will appear to them as though they had not tarried save an evening or the morn thereof.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The Day they see it, (it will be) as if they had not tarried (in this world) except an afternoon or a morning.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On the Day when they witness it—as though they only stayed an evening, or its morning.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: On the Day they see it, they will feel as though they had stayed (in the grave) no more than one evening or one morning.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The Day they see it (it will be) as if they had not tarried (in this world) except an (`Ashiyyah) afternoon or its (Duha) morning.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: On the day when they behold it, it will be as if they had but tarried for an evening or the morn thereof.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The day they see it, it shall be as if they had not stayed [in the world] except for an evening or forenoon.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On the Day when they behold it, it will be as if they had lingered but an evening, or, a morning.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: It will be, on the Day they see it, as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On the day when they see it, it will seem to them as though they had only lived in the world for a morning and an afternoon.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: On the day that they see it, it will be as though they had not tarried but the latter part of a day or the early part of it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kaannahum yawma yarawnah<u>a</u> lam yalbathoo ill<u>a</u> AAashiyyatan aw <u>d</u>u<u>ha</u>h<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On the Day when they see it, they will feel as if they had tarried in this world for only one evening or one morning.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The Day they see it, (It will be) as if they had tarried but a single evening, or (at most till) the following morn!
